results.title: Our shrinking coastline
results.brief_description: Shows the impact of erosion by the sea in some of the most severely threatened areas of the Australian coastline, in particular northern New South Wales and sourthern Queensland. No other credits.

results.title: The Two worlds of Hong Kong
results.creator_credit: Dennis B. Kane and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Explores the clash between the cultures of the East and West as exemplified by the lives of two Hong Kong families. Shows how changing values can affect tradtional lifestyles and strain strong family ties. Also explores the street markets, the religious shrines, and Hong Kong’s busy harbour.

results.title: Geography of South America: Brazil. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Designed to show the great variety of urban and rural life styles which exist in Brazil. Depicts life in the vast Amazon Basin, on coffee and cocoa plantations, in the great coastal cities, and in Brazilia. The Brazilian economy is painted in glowing terms. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: A Career in accountancy
results.creator_credit: Richard Wallace, Garry Blackledge and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Looks at three young people working in the field of accountancy and notes their reasons for choosing accountancy as a career as well as the range of options open to them. Also considers the role played by the Australian Society of Accountants. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Career as a chartered accountant
results.creator_credit: Tony Wellington, Garry Blackledge and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: This film provides an indication of the qualifications necessary to become a chartered accountant and then looks at the various avenues open after completion of studies. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Superman and the bride
results.brief_description: Sets out to take a hard look at the main messages that come to us daily from the media, focusing on images of men and women. Does the mass media give us an accurate picture of the sexes or do they serve up a stereotype diet of sexy, passive females and tough, dynamic males? This atempts to answer these questions using satire, songs, cartoons and clips from film. Cast includes Julie Covington, Jane Meadows, Charlie Stafford. Narrated by Gavin Richards, Stephanie Turner.

results.title: Multicultural education: a teaching style
results.creator_credit: Wayne Threm, David Arnold, Dennis Hicks and Media Five Film
results.brief_description: Looks at the change from the traditional “melting pot” theory to an appreciation of cultural pluralism. Several classroom approaches are demonstrated which encourage ethnic groups to maintain their identity and pride and at the same time learn mutual respect. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Threm, David Arnold, Dennis Hicks and Media Five Film

results.title: Mosaic
results.creator_credit: Louise Jonas, Rob McCubbin and AVRB Film Unit
results.brief_description: Harold Freedman describes the different processes he undertook in constructing the mosaic at the State Offices, Geelong, Victoria, from the painting of the cartoon to final cleaning and grouting. The completed mosaic is shown in detail at the end of the film.

results.title: Indonesia calling
results.creator_credit: Joris Ivens, Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit. and Catherine Duncan
results.brief_description: Appointed as film commissioner to the Dutch Indies, it was intended that Ivens would create educational films on behalf of the Dutch government and would document the liberation of Indonesia from Japanese occupation. When it became obvious that the Dutch government had no interest in granting independance to Indonesia, Ivens resigned. Working clandestinely, he recorded this film in support of the struggle by the Indonesian people to gain their independance. The film shows efforts by Australian dockworkers and striking Indonesian seamen to prevent the shipment of arms and ammunition to Indonesia aboard Dutch vessels. Cinematography, Marion Michelle. Editing, Joris Ivens and Jock Levy. Script, Joris Ivens and Catherine Duncan. Commentary, Peter Finch.
